alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Decatur; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Shelby, west central Decatur and northeastern Bartholomew Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Greensburg, or 14 miles south of Shelbyville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Shelby, west central Decatur and northeastern Bartholomew Counties, including the following locations... Burney, Milford, Hope and Hartsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Indiana.
